xxl.core.spatial.cursors

Class RectangleInputIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      • xxl.core.cursors.sources.io.InputStreamCursor<E>
        • xxl.core.cursors.sources.io.FileInputCursor<Rectangle>
          • xxl.core.spatial.cursors.RectangleInputIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator<Rectangle>, Cursor<Rectangle>

    public class RectangleInputIterator
extends FileInputCursor<Rectangle>
    The RectangleInputIterator constructs an Iterator of rectangles for a given flat File of Rectangle-Objects.

    The flat file is assumed to contain rectangles based on DoublePoints.

    Implementation: 
            public RectangleInputIterator(File file, int bufferSize, final int dim){
                super(new AbstractFunction(){
                        public Object invoke(){
                                return new DoublePointRectangle(dim);
                        }
                }, file, bufferSize);
        }


    Use-case: (create iterator of rectangles, i.e. read rectangless from a flat file) 
            public static void main(String[] args){
                
                Iterator it = new RectangleInputIterator(new File(args[0]), 1024*1024, Integer.parseInt(args[1]));

                Cursors.println(it);    //print elements of Cursor to standard output
        }
    See Also:
    Rectangles, DoublePoint

        file - the file containing the input-data
